msContents.summary: 1 copy of Farhang-i Jahāngīrī by Mīr Jamāl al-Dīn Ḥusayn ibn Fakhr al-Dīn Ḥasan Injū Shīrāzī ʿAz̤ud al-Dawlah

msItem.title: Farhang-i Jahāngīrī
فرهنگ حهانگیری

author.persName: Mīr Jamāl al-Dīn Ḥusayn ibn Fakhr al-Dīn Ḥasan Injū Shīrāzī ʿAz̤ud al-Dawlah
میر جمال الدین حسین بن فخر الدین حسن انجو شیرازی عضد الدولة

msItem.incipit: بسم الله الرحمن الرحیم. فصل الالف از باب الف. آب میه معنی دارد اول معروف است
msItem.explicit: یکسان وسکسون دو معنی دارد اول همیشه وبردوام را گویند دوم برابر آمده باشد

note.p: This manuscript comprises only the dictionary part of the Farhang-i Jahāngīrī.

supportDesc.support: Strong cream woven paper with very clear charts and lines.

foliation.p: European numerals in pencil. Every side is numbered, as opposed to foliated.

condition.p: Excellent condition. Significant worm damage to end of manuscript.

handDesc.summary: Very neat and spacious black-ink nastaʿlīq.

additions.p: On the first page, Jones has written "Dictionary of the Persian Language"

bindingDesc.p: Standard India Office half leather binding with wine-coloured marbled endpapers.

accMat.p: Page 500-1 (one folio) has been added. It is written in extremely difficult to read shikastah script. This page includes the date 1176AH (1762-3AD) or 1172 (1758-9) in the first line of text (date appears to be written as 11762, but the spacing seems to prefer 1176 as the reading).

provenance.p: RSPA 1-118 were presented to the Royal Society in January 1792 by Sir William and Lady Jones.
The Royal Society's collection of 280 Persian and Arabic, and 86 Sanskrit manuscripts were transferred to the India Office Library in 1876.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on E. Denison Ross and E. G. Browne, Catalogue of two collections of Persian and Arabic manuscripts preserved in the India Office Library (London: Eyre and Spottiswoode, 1902), p. 19 no. XXI

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact British Library, Registering for a Reader Pass. Contact apac-enquiries@bl.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript. For information on catalogues and ordering manuscripts see Finding and ordering Persian manuscripts in the British Library.

revisionDesc.change: Julian Cook 850 BL Persian mss prepared for initial publication in FIHRIST (plus 18 replacements)
